tips.text: The place-content utilities are most effective when used with CSS Grid. Ensure the container has display set to grid for predictable results.
Place-content is a shorthand for both align-content and justify-content, so changing it affects alignment in both directions.
These utilities only have visible effects when there is extra space inside the container beyond the size of its content.
Using place-content for simple single-axis alignment can reduce clarity. Prefer justify-content or align-content when only one axis needs control.
Use place-content-center for loaders, empty states, and full-page placeholders where balanced centering improves visual clarity.
